bwwExcerpt: In "Fish in the Dark"...we are asked to consider the etiquette of waking people up with bad news when there's nothing they can do, bringing a date to a hospital, loading dishwashers, corpse removal, honesty after death, tipping doctors, and -- yep -- serving seafood in dim lighting. What is not confronted, however, or at least not confronted on the performers' side of the footlights, is the etiquette of applauding in a theater, especially vis-Ã -vis a hugely hyped, aggressively mediocre Broadway
